subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[嚙]], [[囓]]}} ''({{w|Variant Chinese characters|Variant}} {{w|Traditional Chinese characters|traditional form}} in Chinese)''
* {{l|mul|[[𪘂]]}} ''({{w|Extended shinjitai}})''
* {{l|mul|[[𫜩]]}} ''(Non standard form in {{w|simplified Chinese}})''

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Note that in {{w|traditional Chinese}},  <big>齧</big> has two {{w|Variant Chinese characters|variant forms}} {{l|mul|嚙}} and {{l|mul|囓}} ''(same in meaning and usage but different in appearance)'' whereas in Japanese, <big>齧</big> (''{{w|shinjitai}} form: {{l|mul|𪘂}})'' and {{l|mul|嚙}} (''{{w|shinjitai}} form: {{l|mul|噛}})'' are used in different compound words. In {{w|simplified Chinese}}, only {{l|mul|啮}} is used.

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|s=啮|t2=嚙|t3=囓<!-- Refer 通用規范漢字表 (2013) -->|𫜩-nonstandard simp.}}
